articles.author: Tim Hardwick
articles.title: Apple's Online Store Launches in Vietnam
articles.description:
After announcing last week that it would be launching its online store in Vietnam on May 18, the store has now gone live, opening up direct sales for Apple in a largely untapped market with significant growth potential.

articles.author: Ayana Archie
articles.title: Montana becomes the first state to completely ban TikTok
articles.description: Gov. Greg Gianforte banned the app on state government electronic devices last December, and has said he is concerned about people's user data being compromised by the Chinese government.
articles.content:
A view of the TikTok app logo, in Tokyo, Sept. 28, 2020.
Kiichiro Sato/AP
Montana has become the first state to ban the popular social media app TikTok.

articles.author: Nathan Proctor
articles.title: Companies are radically redefining what it means to 'own' something
articles.description: Companies are using sneaky software, subscription fees, and legal tricks to make you endlessly pay for stuff you already bought.But soon after the release of the iPhone 13 in September 2021, Harding noticed a minor change to Apple's software that he thought might shut down his small shop for good.
articles.content:
Modern software allows manufacturers to tether users to them, forever. That means you may endlessly pay for stuff you already boughtTyler Le/Insider

articles.author: Tim Nelson
articles.title: New York City May Be Sinking Under the Weight of Its Skyscrapers
articles.description: A scientific journal suggests that the city’s 1.68 trillion pounds of buildings are causing the city to descending, with some neighborhoods faster than others
